ld.headline: Squat Candlestick Trading Strategy – High-Volume Exhaustion & Reversal Signals

hero.title: Squat Candle Strategy
hero.subtitle: The Squat Candle Strategy focuses on identifying candles with strong volume but limited price movement — a sign of a power struggle between buyers and sellers. These candles often appear before sharp breakouts or reversals, helping traders anticipate turning points and improve timing and confirmation.

video.aria: Appears during an uptrend near resistance with a high-volume, small-body candle, indicating exhaustion and potential reversal.

items.1: The Squat Candle Strategy identifies potential reversals or points of market exhaustion.
items.2: It relies on spotting a unique candlestick with high volume but limited price movement.
items.3: Squat candles often form near the end of a trend or around support/resistance levels, signaling indecision and potential reversal.

items.1: A squat candle has a small body, meaning limited movement between open and close.
items.2: It features long wicks, showing strong price rejection on both ends.
items.3: It has unusually high volume, revealing strong activity or struggle between buyers and sellers.
items.4: It often forms near key support or resistance levels, hinting at possible reversal or breakout.

items.1: Formation: Appears during an uptrend near resistance with a small body and high volume.
items.2: Interpretation: Suggests buyer exhaustion as price fails to break resistance.
items.3: Confirmation: A bearish candle following the squat candle confirms potential reversal.
items.4: Trade Execution: Traders may short when the next candle closes below the squat candle’s low.

items.1: Formation: Appears during a downtrend near support with a small body and high volume.
items.2: Interpretation: Indicates seller exhaustion as price fails to push lower.
items.3: Confirmation: A bullish candle after the squat candle confirms possible reversal.
items.4: Trade Execution: Traders may go long when the next candle closes above the squat candle’s high.

items.1: Combine squat candles with volume indicators to confirm the strength of the signal.
items.2: Focus on squat candles forming near major support or resistance for higher reversal accuracy.
items.3: Use stop-loss orders just beyond the high or low of the squat candle for risk management.

items.1: Early reversal signal – indicates market exhaustion before trend reverses.
items.3: Works well with other tools like volume, moving averages, and support/resistance zones.

items.1: Requires confirmation – needs a follow-up candle to avoid false signals.
items.2: Less effective in ranging markets – may trigger false reversals in sideways conditions.
items.3: Volume sensitivity – strong volume without price movement can be misleading.
